channel.description: A place where I share my thoughts about programming.

item.title: A closer look at Portable Executable MS-DOS Stub
item.author: mc
item.description: When we open native or .NET windows executables in a hex-editor we can notice that almost all of them contains strange “This program cannot be run in DOS mode” text at the beginning of the file. The original purpose on this text and surrounding it small MS-DOS program, called MS-DOS stub is to print message to the user and then exit if the .exe file is run from under MS-DOS. I in this blog post I will explain how it works and since currently I have only GNU/Linux boxes in my flat I will investigate using only Linux.
